poem:
Title: "The Sons of Calamity"

A blood moon rises, 
Over the sickened monument of America,
In the clamour of an age unborn.
Sinewy shadows of fear, 
In this republic of calculated ruin. 
Under the crucible of a withered presidency,
Life smears itself into obituaries.
Hear the verses of a far-off Caliphate,
And the silence, muffled, of the Mistry woman.
In the echoes, innocence sires war.
